passages.text: Australia | Technology & Information Services Appen

APX 1H25 revenue and underlying EBITDA were slightly below consensus, driven by lower revenue from global services and U.S. government divisions. In our view, margin may face pressure in the short- term due to a shift away from global margin, but may come back to a certain level in the medium term with China's margin improvement. Price target reduced to A\\$1.0/share (previously A\\$2.0), Retain Hold.

Lower global revenue: 1H25 revenue was \(2\%\) below consensus and \(13\%\) below our estimates. FY25 revenue has been revised to the lower end of the guidance range (\\$235- \\$260m), driven by limited visibility to the timing of large LLM projects in global services and U.S. government revenue challenge.
Short- term margin pressure: Although the company reaffirmed positive FY25 underlying EBITDA, a further shift in customer mix leads to a lower underlying EBITDA margin in the short term period.

China potential: New markets- Ent/Cn/Gov were above consensus and our estimates due to stronger- than- expected China revenue. China's underlying EBITDA has been discussed as a low- margin area but increased in 1H25. We see the potential of easing margin pressure from China margin improvement in the medium term. The company reaffirms its midterm guidance.

Earnings and PT change: Lower CY25- 27e revenues \(5 - 7\%\) factoring in revised weaker FY25 revenue guidance to the lower end of the range. Further shift in customer project mix with stronger China revenue (lower margin) and limited visibility in global/U.S. revenue (higher margin) has resulted in underlying EBITDA downgrades of \(36 - 56\%\) . We have underlying EBITDA but increase EV/EBITDA multiple to 1- year historical forward as: 1) growing China margin (it has been discussed as a low- margin area for a while); 2) APX is project- based, so it's hard for the company to predict future revenue. Despite limited visibility in large LLM projects, which downgraded the guidance, large LLM projects may still come through at any time. Price Target reduced to A\\$1/share from A\\$2, which implies 19.5x CY26e EV/EBITDA (previously 14x CY26e EV/EBITDA).

Recommendation: Earnings visibility is limited, especially in large LLM projects. Contract structure is unchanged, with larger tech companies with no recourse on lower than indicated volumes. Retain Hold.

Appen has undergone de- rating over the past two years as the company has seen declining revenue contribution from its largest customer. The company also has concentration risk, with its five largest customers contributing \(>80\%\) of revenues since 2016.

In the near- term, cash flow and liquidity remain risks as the company goes through its cost reduction program, whilst revenues continue to normalise. That said, the May 2023 cap raise has addressed the most immediate overhang.
Over the medium term, a refreshed management team and greater diversification from new market revenues, could drive a recovery in profitability, if revenue decline from major customers normalises.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
Base Case, AUD1, +14%
Our price target implies 19.5x FY26E EV/EBITDA In- line with 1- year historical forward EV/EBITDA (20.2x).
Upside Scenario, AUD1.2, +37%
Our upside scenario is based on 29x FY26E EV/EBITDA.
Downside Scenario, AUD0.25, - 71%

Our downside scenario reflects the risk that APX is no longer able to raise capital and generate meaningful revenues from their new services business as their global services business continues to deteriorate.

The company's recent history has been characterised by a series of material downgrades to consensus forecasts and company guidance, suggesting low visibility around customer demand. The share price has consequently materially underperformed the ASX 300 over the past 18 months. What steps has the company taken to improve business and financial planning and ultimately to provide a more stable outlook for investors?

The company employs over 1m contractors across 170 countries. How does the company's Modern Slavery Policy ensure these contractors are remunerated equitably? Are there any gaps between acceptable levels of remuneration globally and the company's current remuneration levels?

The company's shareholder- long- term remuneration policies received a first strike in 2021. Whilst adjustments to these rem policies have been made, there are still arguably inadequate deferrals and clawbacks of STIs and LTIs given the volatility of earnings. This could lead to a non- matching of management incentives and shareholder returns. Does the company intend to introduce further improvements to its rem policies?

The challenging macroeconomic conditions being faced by the largest 4 customers, and how their AI strategies evolve as they are evaluated. Update for annualised \(\) 10m\$ U.S.- based project. Any changes in U.S.- based revenue from the Enterprise and government division.

Good- Strong China Performance: Revenue in China grew \(67\%\) YoY, with an annualized rate \(\) 100m+$. The region also contributed \(\) 2.9\(million in EBITDA in 1H25, showing an increasing margin trend. - Generative AI Momentum: \(24\%\) of H1 revenue came from generative AI- related projects, and a new engagement with\) \ \(10m\) + annual potential was secured. - Operational Efficiency: \(\) 10\(million in annualised cost efficiencies identified in non- China business.

Limited Visibility on LLM Projects: Uncertainty around timing for large- scale LLM project resumption affects FY25 guidance to the lower end. US Government Division Challenges: Policy uncertainty has hindered short- term revenue generation in APX's enterprise and government division, prompting a \(\) 4m\(OPEX reduction.

Global Services EBITDA Decline: Dropped \(\) 4.7\(million due to short- term volatility and the termination of the Google contract. Capitalised Investment Strategy: Management indicated no major increase in capitalised investment, suggesting H1 levels are a good proxy for the year. Efficiency gains may be realised, but spending will remain disciplined. Al- Driven Operations: Use of generative AI for real- time quality checks, contributor matching, and customer service automation (resolving \(30\%\) of tickets) reflects deep integration of AI into operations. Segment Reporting Changes: APX is considering simplifying its reporting segments due to China's growth and reduced investment in the US government division.
Proprietary technology platforms that enable high quality data at scale
Chart 5 - APX Gloabl revenue
Chart 6 - APX China revenue

Lower CY25- 27e revenues \(5 - 7\%\) due to limited visibility relating to specific timing for the resumption of large LLM projects. Lower LLM revenue in global services and short- term revenue challenges in U.S. government division, which are higher- margin areas, have resulted in underlying EBITDA downgrades of \(36 - 56\%\) .
Chart 7 - JEF revision for APX
Source:Jefferies,Company data

We lower our price target for APX to A\\$1.0 (previously A\\$2.0). Our price target is set at 19.5x CY26e EV/EBITDA. FY26e target EV/EBITDA multiple is set 1 s.d. to historical 1- year forward average EV/ EBITDA multiple, based on: 1) Limited visibility to timing for resumption of large LLM revenue in global services division and the short- term revenue challenge in U.S. government division; 2) a weaker FY25 outlook based on management's outlook commentary; 3) cost- out execution which management state is on track, but thus far we have seen limited evidence of this; 4) growing China margin.
Chart 8 - Appen 1-year forward EV/EBITDA chart
Source: Jefferies estimates, FactSet
Chart 9 - APX 1-yr forward EV/sales band chart
Source: Jefferies, FactSet
Chart 10 - APX 1-yr forward PB band chart
Source: Jefferies, FactSet

AppenAppen delivers human annotated datasets for machine learning and artificial intelligence. The business comprises two segments; Global Services (content relevance) and New Markets (speech & image). Global Services provides annotated data used in search technology for improving relevance and accuracy of search results and content. New Markets segment comprises data used in speech recognition, machine translation and image and video recognition. The company was founded in 2011 and listed on the ASX in early 2015.

Our price target implies 19.5x FY26E EV/EBITDA. In- line with 1- year historical forward EV/EBITDA (20.2x). Our rating reflects the high uncertainty in our future forecasts based on limited visibility on continued revenue recovery at this point in time.
Downside risks: Loss of further big tech customers; volatility in project contracts.
Upside risks: Large LLM projects in global services come through; US government revenues come back with more stable policy; increasing China margin with its growing revenue.
(Article 3(1)e and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.

NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company. Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
- Appen Limited (APX AU: AUD0.88, HOLD)
